item.title: Anna add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Anna add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Anna add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Anna add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "Let children read whatever they want and then talk about it with them. If parents and kids can talk together, we won't have as much censorship because we won't have as much fear." -- Judy Blume

item.title: Anna add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "I would be most content if my children grew up to be the kind of people who think decorating consists mostly of building enough bookshelves." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: Anna add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The most interesting information come from children, for they tell all they know and then stop." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Anna add a quote by Carl Sandburg
item.description: "A baby is God's opinion that the world should go on." -- Carl Sandburg

item.title: Anna add a quote by Rick Riordan
item.description: "Young people don't always do what they're told, but if they can pull it off and do something wonderful, sometimes they escape punishment. " -- Rick Riordan

item.title: Anna add a quote by Walt Disney
item.description: "Our greatest national resource is the minds of our children." -- Walt Disney

item.title: Anna add a quote by Frederick Douglass
item.description: "It is easier to build strong children than to repair broken men." -- Frederick Douglass

item.title: Anna add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "I have a dream that my four little children will one day live in a nation where they will not be judged by the color of their skin but by the content of their character." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Anna add a quote by Barbara Johnson
item.description: "To be in your children's memories tomorrow, You have to be in their lives today." -- Barbara Johnson

item.title: Anna add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Those who educate children well are more to be honored than they who produce them; for these only gave them life, those the art of living well." -- Aristotle

item.title: Anna add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Don't handicap your children by making their lives easy." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Anna add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Children must be taught how to think, not what to think." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Anna add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Schizoid behavior is a pretty common thing in children. It's accepted, because all we adults have this unspoken agreement that children are lunatics." -- Stephen King

item.title: Anna add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "Think for a minute, darling: in fairy tales it's always the children who have the fine adventures. The mothers have to stay at home and wait for the children to fly in the window." -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Anna add a quote by Sue Monk Kidd
item.description: "Nobody around here had ever seen a lady beekeeper till her. She liked to tell everybody that women made the best beekeepers, 'cause they have a special ability built into them to love creatures that sting. It comes from years of loving children and husbands." -- Sue Monk Kidd

item.title: Anna add a quote by Emilie Buchwald
item.description: "Children are made readers on the laps of their parents." -- Emilie Buchwald

item.title: Anna add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "Consequently, if you believe God made Satan, you must realize that all Satan's power comes from God and so that Satan is simply God's child, and that we are God's children also. There are no children of Satan, really." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Anna add a quote by Plato
item.description: "There is truth in wine and children" -- Plato

item.title: Anna add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "In the lives of children, pumpkins turn into coaches, mice and rats turn into men. When we grow up, we realize it is far more common for men to turn into rats." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Anna add a quote by Stanley Kubrick
item.description: "I think the big mistake in schools is trying to teach children anything, and by using fear as the basic motivation. Fear of getting failing grades, fear of not staying with your class, etc. Interest can produce learning on a scale compared to fear as a nuclear explosion to a firecracker." -- Stanley Kubrick

item.title: Anna add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "Fairies have to be one thing or the other, because being so small they unfortunately have room for one feeling only at a time." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Anna add a quote by Richelle Mead
item.description: "Vampires. Honestly, they're like children sometimes. " -- Richelle Mead

item.title: Anna add a quote by Jim Henson
item.description: "The most sophisticated people I know - inside they are all children. " -- Jim Henson

item.title: Anna add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "If we are to reach real peace in the world, we shall have to begin with the children." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Anna add a quote by Bill Cosby
item.description: "Human beings are the only creatures that allow their children to come back home." -- Bill Cosby

item.title: Anna add a quote by Elizabeth Berg
item.description: "You are always in my thoughts. When you were little, I knew your whereabouts at any given moment. Now that you are...off on your own, I still always know where you are, because I keep you in my heart." -- Elizabeth Berg

item.title: Anna add a quote by Marianne Williamson
item.description: "There is nothing enlightened about shrinking so that other people won't feel insecure around you. We are all meant to shine, as children do." -- Marianne Williamson
